alert.note: Alert for Central Douglas County; Eastern Curry County and Josephine County; Eastern Douglas County Foothills; Jackson County (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 06 at 9:44PM PST until January 07 at 10:00AM PST by NWS Medford
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM PST SUNDAY ABOVE 2000 FEET... * WHAT...Snow expected above 2000 feet. Total snow accumulations of 1 to 5 inches. * WHERE...Elevations above 2000 feet in eastern Curry, Josephine, eastern Douglas and Jackson Counties including the cities of Toketee Falls, Butte Falls, and Ashland. Impacted roadways include the lower I-5 passes of Sexton Summit and Canyon Mountain and portions of highways 140, 62, 138, and 238. * WHEN...Until 10 AM PST Sunday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions and low visibilities due to snow and blowing snow. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow levels may lower to 1500 feet late tonight and early Sunday morning with light snow of less than an inch down to lower valley floors. * View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction: * Slow down and allow extra time to reach your destination. * Carry tire chains and be prepared for snow covered roads and limited visibilities. * See https://www.tripcheck.com for latest road conditions. * A Winter Weather Advisory for snow means that periods of snow will cause travel difficulties.

area.areaDesc: Central Douglas County; Eastern Curry County and Josephine County; Eastern Douglas County Foothills; Jackson County
